tool.name: SNVtest
tool.description: - identifies changes in allele frequency between alignment mappings
tool.command:
snvtest.py
## Inputs --input1=$input1 --input2=$input2
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --max_depth=$default_full_settings.max_depth --pvalue=$default_full_settings.pvalue --cutoff=$default_full_settings.cutoff #end if
## Output file --output=$output

param.help: Default settings are suitable for most analyses. If you want full control, use Full parameter list
param.label: SNVtest settings to use
param.name: settings_type

param.label: Maximum depth requirement. Sites with higher depth would be filtered
param.name: max_depth

tool.help:
**What it does**
SNVtest uses Fisher's Exact Test to detect sites with significantly allele frequency change between two populations. The results of this tool is used by the SOAPsnv process to detect single nucleotide variants.
**More information**
For test data and more detailed information, click here_.
.. _here: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/SOAPsnv.html
